name: Epinephrine
indications: epinephrine non-selective alpha beta adrenergic agonist indicated : increase mean arterial blood pressure adult patients hypotension associated septic shock . ( 1.1 ) emergency treatment allergic ( type 1 ) , including anaphylaxis . ( 1.2 ) induction maintenance mydriasis intraocular surgery . ( 1.3 )
contraindications: • hypotension associated septic shock ( 2.2 ) : dilute epinephrine dextrose solution prior infusion . infuse epinephrine large vein . titrate 0.05-2 mcg/kg/min achieve desired blood pressure . wean gradually . • anaphylaxis ( 2.3 ) : administer intramuscularly subcutaneously anterolateral thigh every 5-10 minutes needed adults children 30 kg ( 66 lb ) : 0.3-0.5 mg ( 0.3-0.5 ml ) children 30 kg ( 66 lb ) : 0.01 mg/kg ( 0.01 ml/kg ) • intraocular surgery ( 2.4 ) : dilute 1 ml 100 1000 ml ophthalmic irrigation fluid , ophthalmic irrigation intracameral injection .
warningsAndPrecautions: epinephrine injection usp , 1 mg/ml sterile solution containing 1 mg/1 ml epinephrine 2 ml clear glass ampule . supplied box 10 single-use ampules ndc : 70518-1215-00 ndc : 70518-1215-01 packaging : 10 1 box packaging : 1 ml 1 ampule , type 0 epinephrine light sensitive . protect light ready . refrigerate . protect freezing . store room temperature , 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . ( usp controlled room temperature . ) protect alkalis oxidizing agents . inspect visually particulate matter discoloration prior . solution colored cloudy , contains particulate matter . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
indications_original: Epinephrine is a non-selective alpha and beta adrenergic agonist indicated: To increase mean arterial blood pressure in adult patients with hypotension associated with septic shock. ( 1.1 ) For emergency treatment of allergic reactions (Type 1), including anaphylaxis. ( 1.2 ) For induction and maintenance of mydriasis during intraocular surgery. ( 1.3 )
contraindications_original: • Hypotension associated with septic shock (2.2): o Dilute epinephrine in dextrose solution prior to infusion. o Infuse epinephrine into a large vein. o Titrate 0.05-2 mcg/kg/min to achieve desired blood pressure. o Wean gradually. • Anaphylaxis (2.3): Administer intramuscularly or subcutaneously into anterolateral thigh every 5-10 minutes as needed o Adults and children over 30 kg (66 lb): 0.3-0.5 mg (0.3-0.5 mL) o Children under 30 kg (66 lb): 0.01 mg/kg (0.01 mL/kg) • Intraocular surgery (2.4): o Dilute 1 mL with 100 to 1000 mL of an ophthalmic irrigation fluid, for ophthalmic irrigation or intracameral injection.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Epinephrine Injection USP, 1 mg/mL is a sterile solution containing 1 mg/1 mL epinephrine in a 2 mL clear glass ampule. Supplied in a box of 10 single-use ampules
                  
                  NDC: 70518-1215-00
                  NDC: 70518-1215-01
                  PACKAGING: 10 in 1 BOX
                  PACKAGING: 1 mL in 1 AMPULE, TYPE 0
                  
                  Epinephrine is light sensitive. Protect from light until ready to use.
                  Do not refrigerate. Protect from freezing.
                  Store at room temperature, between 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). (See USP Controlled Room Temperature.) Protect from alkalis and oxidizing agents.
                  Inspect visually for particulate matter and discoloration prior to administration. Do not use the solution if it is colored or cloudy, or if it contains particulate matter.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
